intro: Hesperomannia arbuscula subsp. oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the Hawaiian archipelago. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
